result.execSummary:
The defendant Britany N Bell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Probation may be transferred to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes: Restitution for Target to be paid as a condition of probation, joint and several with co-defendant.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

No Contact with Target Stores. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent. 
May terminate probation after 9 months if deemed appropriate by agent. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. STAYED for use at agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt: Order revoking huber privileges.  Signed by Judge Carter on 05/02/16.
Dated 04/28/16, from Jail Adminstration requestion that the Court formally revoke defendant's Huber privileges.

Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Britany N Bell in court with Attorney Nicole Williams Buttery.  Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for plea and sentencing.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Counts #2 & 3 are dismissed and read-in.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Williams Buttery makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

6 MONTHS HUBER 

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR      *May terminate after 9 months, if deemed appropriate by agent*      **Transfer allowed to Milwaukee County**

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____No contact with: Target stores

RESTITUTION:  $294.91 - Joint and Several with Co-actor Kyle S. (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $253.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  30 DAYS, Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion
Plea/sentencing hearing at 01-04-2016 02:30 pm

Defendant Britany N Bell in court with Attorney Nicole Williams Buttery.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Williams Buttery requests a plea and sentence date.    Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Hearing at 11-06-2015 09:00 am

Hearing at 09-28-2015 10:30 am

Defendant Britany N Bell in court.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states she qualified for public defender representation.  Court adjourns so Defendant can appear at next date with counsel.    Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on August 31, 2015 at 10:30 am.
